item.source: Simplifying my server -> client text method

item.title: Simplifying my server -> client text method
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;

public class Logger {

	private static BufferedOutputStream os;

	private static OutputStreamWriter osw;

	static {
		os = new BufferedOutputStream(connection.getOutputStream());
                try {
                    osw = new OutputStreamWriter(os, "US-ASCII");
                } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException ex) {
                    ex.printStackTrace();
                }
        }

	public static void send(String message, boolean useTimeStamp) {
		String returnCode = message;
		if (useTimeStamp) returnCode += " [" + TimeStamp + "]";
		returnCode += (char) 13;
		try {
			osw.write(returnCode);
			osw.flush();
		} catch (IOException ex) {
			ex.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

}

I don’t know where your connection object or TimeStamp variable is located.

Read full topic

item.title: Simplifying my server -> client text method
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

I currently have this “method” (as in a literal method as opposed to a Java method):

String returnCode = "THIS IS THE SERVER [" + TimeStamp +"]"+ (char) 13; BufferedOutputStream os = new BufferedOutputStream( connection.getOutputStream()); OutputStreamWriter osw = new OutputStreamWriter(os, "US-ASCII"); osw.write(returnCode); osw.flush(); } catch (IOException e) {} catch (InterruptedException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
Would there be any way to condense this into a class such as, for example, my “Logger” class, and only have to do:

with the boolean denoting the timestamp.
I know how to do all of this, but I fuck up every time I try to put it into another class.

Read full topic
